column1: What is the symptomatic difference between stable angina and the acute coronary syndromes?
column2: Patients with new or increasing symptoms are labelled as suffering an ACS whereas those with chronic symptoms are classified as stable angina.

column1: What is the most common first presentation of coronary artery disease in men and women?
Name ten traditional risk factors for ischaemic heart disease?
column2: MED FACTORS. Male, Exercise (lack of), Diabetes, Family Hx of premature coronary artery, Age (advanced), Cholesterol, Tension (HTN), Obesity, Recent MI (or any previous coronary dz), Smoking
